title: mention the controller along the scope
feat(scenario): expose jQuery for usage outside of angular scenario
body:
We are using jQuery in some custom angular scenario dsl methods. Unfortunately the jQuery included in angular-scneario is not available for us, because via noConflict() the global reference is removed and only a local reference is kept. To remove the necessity to include a second jQuery in our test setup, this commit adds a angular.scenario.jQuery variable, making jQuery available for others.

I already signed the CLA. My full name is Andreas Marek.

Best regards

title: mention the controller along the scope
body: the default description can be more precise by illustrating what the controller applies to

title: add formatting
body: the string literal {{query}} was missing as it was not enclosed into ``

title: describe more what the unit test does
body: The default description lacks essential information

title: fix(ngMock): allow $timeout.flush to check against the timeout delay
fix($$urlUtils): remove dependency on $window
body:
$window may be mocked out in tests causing those tests to fail.  So
don't use $window.

title: docs(bootstrap): Note that ngScenario requires ngApp
body:
ngScenario expects an ngApp directive to be used, and doesn't work for
manually bootstrapped apps. The failure mode is to hang on navigation.

Trying to make this wont-fix bug less obscure by documenting it.
Eventually Protractor will replace ngScenario and fix this.

title: Ng bind html sce
body:
Changes:
- remove ng-bind-html-unsafe
- ng-bind-html is now in core
- ng-bind-html is secure
    - supports SCE - so you can bind to an arbitrary trusted string
    - automatic sanitization if $sanitize is available

BREAKING CHANGE:
  ng-html-bind-unsafe has been removed and replaced by ng-html-bind
  (which has been removed from ngSanitize.)  ng-bind-html provides
  ng-html-bind-unsafe like behavior (innerHTML's the result without
  sanitization) when bound to the result of $sce.trustAsHtml(string).
  When bound to a plain string, the string is sanitized via $sanitize
  before being innerHTML'd.  If $sanitize isn't available, it's logs an
  exception.

title: Under certain circumstances location.href is not defined in IE8.
body: It sometimes causes an infinite routing loop.

title: feat(copy, equals): copy and equals can now handle cyclic structures.
Make $urlUtils public and add a resolve callback
Fix for PR 2738
Update cacheFactory.js
body: Corrected spelling.

title: Added missing seed app link to menu in docs
body: On angularjs.org, under learn there is a link to the seed app. This link was missing from the menu on docs.angularjs.org.

title: feat(): added scope as an optional argument to $timeout()
docs($window): improve style and clarify wording
chore(ngMock): remove jstestdriver
body: - actually, removing jstestdriver we're fixing breaking test of publishing dump on window

title: chore($apply): use minErr to throw exception
docs(ngController): remove obsolete mention of scope as `this` in contro...
body:
...ller

Controllers are now (since angular 1.0) instantiated as regular constructors, and the scope is injectable as $scope rather than being referenced as `this` in controller methods.

title: feat(ngSanitize): linky does not sanitize when used in ngBindHtml directive
body:
Look at the top comment here: http://docs.angularjs.org/api/ngSanitize.filter:linky

... and here is a demo of the undesirable behavior: http://jsfiddle.net/5uSnj/

The purpose of this pull request is to hopefully push this issue further along and gain some attention.

The attached code creates a new directive which calls the htmlParser with a new argument to 'linkify' URLs that are not already wrapped in an <a> tag.  I am not very experienced with AngularJS and JavaScript, so this is probably not The Best approach.  There must be some way to simply use the ngBindHtml directive with the linky filter for the desired behavior.

Thanks!
Brian

title: Fix input [number] example
body: The input [number] error spans did not show on the example, as they were relying on an non-existing property (myForm.list.$error) vs the working property (myForm.$error)

title: feat ngRepeat: add $even and $odd properties to iterator
body:
When iterating, odd/even status is often nice to to have readily available in a
highly readable way.
These properties are not coupled to using CSS classes in the way of ngClassEven
and ngClassOdd directives.

title: Spelling fixes for documentation and JSDoc corrections
body: I fixed a lot of spelling errors as I was going through some documentation tonight. Also corrected a few JSDoc's that didn't have parameter specifications or had incorrect spec's.

title: docs(ngRepeat): add example for filters in conjunction with `track by`
body: Refer issue #3019

title: fix($parse): unwrap promise when setting a field
body:
This fixes an inconsistency where you can't call the setter function
when the expression resolves to a top level field name on a promise.

Setting a field on an unresolved promise will throw an exception.  (This
shouldn't really happen in your template/js code and points to a
programming error.)

Closes #1827

title: test(ngRepeat): add a test for ngRepeat when using 'track by' and a filter
body: Addresses issue #3019.

title: Update index.ngdoc
body:
docs: change format from md to html 

Tutorial had md formatting that wasn't being rendered in the browser. Added some html tags to fix.

title: fix($sniffer): olders IOS transitions/animations detection
body: Removed the android detection because isn't only on old Android device, we have the same issue on IOS 5.1.1 and lower

title: Tutorial: CSS: Preserve newlines for better readability
